creator: michael.trindler@id.unizh.ch
text:
(Lenya Rel. 1.2.x - Rev.: 156186 - default publication) 

two nodes:
- inaccessible
- accessible

userA with "edit" access on "accessible" (and no other privs)
-> userA can NOT log in on "inacessible"

-> userA logs in on "acessible"
-> (site area) > edit > delete

the (hidden) variables in the html source of the (now appearing) screen show the
settings needed to delete a node

userA may now modifiy the URL to delete node "inacessible" (on which he has NO
access) and can successfully delete "inacessible" (though it still remains in
"trash")

******** annex *******

https://cms.unizh.ch/lenya/default/info-authoring/accessible.html?lenya.usecase=delete&lenya.step=delete&lenya.event=delete&task-id=deleteDocument&properties.node.firstdocumentid=/inaccessible&properties.firstarea=authoring&properties.secarea=trash&parenturl=/lenya/default/info-authoring/accessible.html

creator: andreas@apache.org
text: It would be great to have a web test for this.

creator: nettings@apache.org
text: cannot reproduce with 1.4, changed milestone accordingly.
